column28: Language barrier

The challenges I have faced in learning or using English at my university include difficulties in academic writing, and maintaining clarity.Public speaking, editing, and understanding technical terms in media and research were also challenging. However, continuous practice and exposure have helped me improve.
column29: To improve my English proficiency, I have used academic reading, writing practice, and constant exposure to journalism and media content. Engaging in research, presentations, and scriptwriting has enhanced my skills. Additionally, proofreading, feedback from mentors, and practical experience in theater and media projects have helped me refine my language use.
column30: Yes, my university should implement language support programs, such as academic writing workshops, public speaking sessions etc. Interactive sessions, peer reviews, and personalized feedback would help students improve their proficiency effectively.

column28: I find it challenging to comprehend the primary Hindi medium lessons, which has affected my participation in classes and extracurricular activities. Furthermore, the limited availability of English teaching resources at the university contributes to a lack of confidence among local students in speaking English, making it less conducive for international students like me to engage in communicate effectively.
column29: I am an avid reader who reviews and proofreads books in my free time, which has been vital for continuously improving my English proficiency. Growing up in an English-speaking country with a diverse curriculum further strengthened my comprehension skills and expanded my vocabulary. It also helped that I was a member of several community development and debate groups prior to my arrival in India.
column30: Yes, I believe the University of Lucknow lacks sufficient resources to support and promote English learning among students. Initiatives such as volunteer reading programs in underprivileged areas, author visits, literary activities and competitions could significantly boost English literacy. In addition, expanding the libraries to include a broader selection of contemporary English-written novels could help foster greater interest in reading within the university community.
